00007 // Description:
00008 //
00009 // class SyncSoundProcess - allows for one sound process to wait until another
00010 //    sound process of the same type is completed before beginning to play
00011 //
00013

00031 // SyncSoundProcess 
00033 
00034 SyncSoundProcess::SyncSoundProcess(
00035         CScreen* screen,
00036         IPacResource &ipacsound, 
00037         int typeOfSound, 
00038         bool bLoop ) :
00039         CProcess(PROC_SYNC),
00040         m_ipacsound(ipacsound),
00041         m_type( typeOfSound ),
00042         m_loop( bLoop ),
00043         m_screen( screen ),
00044         //BEGIN KIS(3-20-02) | Jokerz 1614 : SyncSoundProcess was treating itself as game sound when its supposed to be dealer sound
00045         //This happened because member variables are not initilized in the order that they are in the init list
00046         m_pSoundProc(new CSoundProcess(screen, ipacsound, typeOfSound))
00047         //m_pSoundProc(new CSoundProcess(m_screen, m_ipacsound, m_type))
00048         //END KIS(3-20-02) | Jokerz 1614
00049 {
00050         m_pSoundProc->AddRef();
00051 
00052         // Kill if no sound
00053         if ( gApp.GetVolume( m_type ) == 0 )
00054         {
00055                 Kill();
00056         }
00057 }
00058 
00059 /*
00060 SyncSoundProcess::SyncSoundProcess(
00061         CScreen* screen, 
00062         CSoundResource *soundResource, 
00063         int typeOfSound,

00066         m_pSoundProc(NULL)
00067 {
00068         m_screen = screen;
00069         m_soundResource = soundResource;
00070         m_type = typeOfSound;
00071         m_loop = bLoop;
00072         m_ipacsound = IPacResource();

00081 
00082 SyncSoundProcess::~SyncSoundProcess()
00083 {
00084         SAFE_RELEASE( m_pSoundProc );
00085 }
00086 
00087 void SyncSoundProcess::OnUpdate(const int delta)
00088 {
00089         // Call base
00090         CProcess::OnUpdate(delta);
00091 
00092         if ( ! m_bKill )
00093         {
00094                 bool readyToPlay = !m_screen->IsProcessActive(m_type);
00095                 //The dealer processes have a special case in which they must be polite to other avatars
00096                 if(m_type==PROC_SOUNDDEALER)
00097                 {
00098                         readyToPlay = readyToPlay && !m_screen->IsProcessActive(PROC_SOUNDVOICE);
00099                 }
00100 
00101                 if(readyToPlay)
00102                 {
00103                         /*
00104                         SAFE_RELEASE( m_pSoundProc );
00105                         if (m_soundResource)
00106                         {
00107                                 m_pSoundProc = new CSoundProcess(m_screen, m_soundResource, m_type);
00108                         }
00109                         else
00110                         {
00111                                 m_pSoundProc = new CSoundProcess(m_screen, m_ipacsound, m_type);
00112                         }
00113                         */
00114 
00115                         // Hand to screen
00116                         m_screen->Attach(m_pSoundProc);
00117                         
00118                         // All done with it...
00119                         SAFE_RELEASE( m_pSoundProc );
00120                         Kill();
00121                 }
00122         }
00123 }
